private_information: I am available on Tuesday Oct 21 from 09:00 to 11:00 and from 13:00 to 16:00
alice.goal: Help find a 30 minute meeting slot on Tuesday Oct 21 when all participants are available.

private_information: I am available on Tuesday Oct 21 from 10:30 to 12:00 and from 14:00 to 15:30
bob.goal: Help find a 30 minute meeting slot on Tuesday Oct 21 when all participants are available.

private_information: I am available on Tuesday Oct 21 from 09:30 to 10:30, from 11:00 to 12:30, and from 15:00 to 17:00
carol.goal: Help find a 30 minute meeting slot on Tuesday Oct 21 when all participants are available.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem for the POPF2 solver that finds the earliest 30 minute meeting slot on Tuesday Oct 21 that works for all three, and if multiple slots are valid prefer the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues need to schedule a 30 minute meeting on Tuesday Oct 21
The meeting must start and end within the participants availability windows
Times are represented in 24 hour format and aligned to 30 minute boundaries

availability.system_prompt: You are Alice. Based on your private information list all 30 minute time slots on Tuesday Oct 21 that fit entirely inside your availability windows. Represent slots as start-end times using 24 hour format, for example 09:00-09:30. Only list slots within your stated windows.

You are Bob. Based on your private information list all 30 minute time slots on Tuesday Oct 21 that fit entirely inside your availability windows. Represent slots as start-end times using 24 hour format, for example 10:30-11:00. Only list slots within your stated windows.

You are Carol. Based on your private information list all 30 minute time slots on Tuesday Oct 21 that fit entirely inside your availability windows. Represent slots as start-end times using 24 hour format, for example 09:30-10:00. Only list slots within your stated windows.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL modelling for the POPF2 planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the participants Alice Bob and Carol, their available 30 minute time slots on Tuesday Oct 21 as timed facts, and a planning task that finds a single 30 minute meeting assignment that overlaps all three availabilities. The planner target is POPF2 so use a PDDL dialect compatible with POPF2 and include explicit numeric or temporal constructs as needed. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and enclose the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Also include a short human readable comment after the PDDL indicating the selected slot and why it was chosen with respect to minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the three participants availability lists. Integrate them to find common overlapping 30 minute slots. If multiple common slots exist choose the earliest slot that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule. That means prefer slots that start later in Bob's morning availability when ties occur, or prefer an afternoon slot over a morning slot if it reduces interference with Bob's morning contiguous block. Provide a PDDL domain and problem for POPF2 that, when solved, yields the chosen slot. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
